definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Did someone tell you that the balloonist has arrived?
sentences.chinese: 有人告訴你那個熱氣球飛行家已經來了嗎？

sentences.english: See the four of us and Chichi sitting in the basket of the hot-air balloon.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，我們四個人和奇奇正坐在熱氣球的籃子裏。

sentences.english: Immediately upon formation, the fireball begins to grow rapidly and rise like a hot air balloon.
sentences.chinese: 火球在形成之後立刻迅速膨脹並上升，像熱氣球一樣。

sentences.english: In all, the balloonists were active for a little under two years.
sentences.chinese: 總之，熱氣球在兩年裏並沒有發揮很大的作用。

sentences.english: I saw the hot balloon standing up into the sky slowly.
sentences.chinese: 我看到熱氣球緩緩地升上了天空。

sentences.english: 1783 was the year people first flew in an hot-air balloon.
sentences.chinese: 1783年，人類第一次乘坐熱氣球飛行。

sentences.english: Kongming lanterns and hot-air balloons are based on the same principle.
sentences.chinese: 孔明燈和熱氣球，其實是一個原理。

sentences.english: Amazing hot air balloon shaped like a giant Coca-Cola bottle.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的可口可樂瓶造型熱氣球。

sentences.english: The hot air balloon rises slowly from the ground, it was more gentle and …
sentences.chinese: 熱氣球緩緩的從地面升起，那比想像中平緩許多。

sentences.english: The only word in the English language that has 4 sets of double letters in a row is balloonneer.
sentences.chinese: 英語中唯一有四隊疊詞的單詞是熱氣球飛行員。

sentences.english: This balloon was a 38-foot diameter globe-shaped linen bag lined with 3 layers of paper.
sentences.chinese: 這個熱氣球是38英尺直徑全球形亞麻袋內襯3層紙。

sentences.english: We'll build a hot-air balloon and…
sentences.chinese: 我想乘坐熱氣球飛越大西洋。

sentences.english: A man in a hot air balloon realized he was lost.
sentences.chinese: 一個男人在熱氣球上，發現自己迷失了方向。

sentences.english: Do you know what a hot-air balloon is?
sentences.chinese: 瞧，我們四個人和奇奇正坐在熱氣球的籃子裏。

sentences.english: Lucy loved it when her Uncle Tom took her up in his hot air ballon.
sentences.chinese: 露西的叔叔帶她去坐熱氣球時，露西好喜歡。

definition: a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
to fly across/to fly over/to fly past/(literary) (of one's spirits) to soar
Hualien, city and county on the east coast of Taiwan
